title: Continuous Bernoulli distribution
summary: In probability theory, statistics, and machine learning, the continuous Bernoulli distribution[1][2][3] is a family of continuous probability distributions  parameterized by a single shape parameter λ ∈ ( 0 , 1 ) {\displaystyle \lambda \in (0,1)} , defined on the unit interval x ∈ [ 0 , 1 ] {\displaystyle x\in [0,1]} , by:
